catchphrase: Join us for the original HalfStack event this November in London!
description: 200 Front-end / Web / JavaScript / Mobile / IoT developers and decision makers
Mostly from the greater London area and the UK
faqs: Does HalfStack London have last minute tickets available?
Not always. We love our venue but we're constrained by its size. Get your ticket early to save and avoid disappointment!
schedule: HalfStack starts around 10am, includes approximately 10 sessions, breaks, lunch, dinner, and the JS Pub Quiz afterparty. Plan to arrive between 9:00-9:45am and stay late!

description: Javascript is extremely versatile. We use it to build front-end, back-end, desktop, and mobile apps. But did you know you can even create music with it?!

Rowdy will show you how easy and fun it is to code your own music with the Web Audio API. As a bonus, he will throw in the Web MIDI API and Web Bluetooth API to really get the party started. Letâ€™s turn up the bass!
sessions.title: Beats in the Browser

description: Inspired by the game Plants vs. Zombies, Ramona will help us create a secure environment for your web application through test automation.
sessions.title: Plants vs Thieves

description: Machine learning models are interpreting the world and generative AI is taking over more and more of our tasks. What if we could use all this magic directly on our devices?
With WebAssembly and WebGPU, we have the tools to make all this possible. It's time to get ready for some unexpected examples of how to use AI in the browser!
sessions.title: From ML to LLM: on-device AI in the browser

description: Carly loves baking shows. And there's a particular one that circulates in social media that you need to determine if it's real or a cake.
She struggles to pick which one is the cake that leads her to build a model to better find the cakes using JavaScript.
In this talk, let's test your cake identification skills against the machine learning model Carly made and use the pre-existing models.
sessions.title: Is it (F)ake?! Image Classification with TensorFlow.js

description: Have you hosted a murder mystery party but dreaded the paper puzzles and constant character confusion?
For Halloween, Tiger and Daphne tricked out their party with Node.js by building an electromagnetic chest, IoT-powered dramatic deaths, and a digital character sheet
They relied on JavaScript to enhance the immerse role-playing game and elevated their home into an escape room. Come learn how to use your programming skills to become the ultimate party host!
sessions.title: How to automate your murder mystery: immersive games in your home

description: Previously Joe has delighted HalfStack community with voice-based Flappy Bird, head-to-head Tetris, and other hilarious game adventures. We'll soon reveal Joe's session details.
sessions.title: To be revealed

description: Jo has amazed the HalfStack community with the LED Christmas jumper, LED mask captioning, and a serverless seance. We'll soon reveal Jo's session details.
sessions.title: To be revealed

description: Leo will explore the Cult of Done Manifesto and how it relates to software and other creative endeavors.
sessions.title: The Cult of Done

description: Voice interfaces surround us daily, helping us with some tasks. But let's forget productivity for a second and experiment with our voice on the Web.
We will look at the current state of the Web Speech API, explore its potential in Karaoke, and have some fun!
sessions.title: Unlocking Fun Experiments: Exploring the Web Speech API

description: To be revealed
sessions.title: To be revealed

description: A couple of additional sessions to be revealed closer to the event, or maybe not until the day of
